9.27.22  3:22 am   for the parts in your songs where theres like a little lick between lyrics, are those present in the writing process or do they show up during the production process?

Â Â Â Â Â  sometimes yes, sometimes no. i will spot check some songs and tell you which is which:
Â Â Â Â Â Â in the song "where i've been", after the line "where i was, i'm gone" this riff was NOT in the writing.
Â Â Â Â Â Â in the song "where i've been", after the line "into another day" this riff was in the writing.
Â Â Â Â Â Â in the song "the ending", the following lines were in the writing:
Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â the first 4 bars of instrumentalÂ Â Â Â Â Â 
Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â the low piano riff after "still sounds musical"
Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â the 2nd verse melody (before and after the flagpole part) (same as the first verse)
Â Â Â Â Â Â in the song "the ending", the following lines were NOT in the writing:
Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â the low piano riffs halfway through the choruses (after "wanna be" and "rather be")
Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â the low piano riff going into the final chorus (not worthy)
Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â the plucked violin riff after "musical music is true"
Â Â Â Â Â Â in the song "meet me in september", the riff after "celebrate/complicated" was in the writing. Â Â Â Â Â Â 
Â Â Â Â Â Â in the song "and the day goes on", in the bridge, after "long gone", the riff here was not in the writing, but the chords under it were
Â Â Â Â Â Â the solo in "airport terminal" (around "night return") is improvised
Â Â Â Â Â Â the instrumental intro to "slow down" was not in the writing.
Â Â Â Â Â Â in "christmas isn't real", the low riff leading into "dumptrucks" was not in the writing
Â Â Â Â Â Â in "movie star", the lick in the midpoint of the 3rd verse (pants, planes, etc) at 2min was not in the writing
Â Â Â Â Â Â the solo chorus in "la de da" was only in the writing as much as to say it must quote "where did all the good times go" around bar 3-4. the rest being open
Â Â Â Â Â Â the riff in "hello sexy pants" after "lights go black" was not in the writing
Â Â Â Â Â Â in "in california", the organ riffs after "arizona", "colorado", and "indiana", were in the writing. however, the horn stabs simultaneous to those riffs were not.
Â Â Â Â Â Â in "i'm a princess", the chorus riff (during the 8 bars after 'about my world') was in the writing. the solo in the last chorus (the 3 bars after 'friends in need') was not in the writing
Â Â Â Â Â Â

9.27.22  1:35 am   How did the double sharp symbol (ğ„ª) come to be?

Â Â Â Â Â i have no idea

     Why isn't it just â™¯â™¯ like the double flat symbol (ğ„«)?

Â Â Â Â Â i was actually wondering why double-flat does not have a unique symbol. i think a single symbol would be better

     All I could find on the Internet were people who claimed the question was stupid and "that's just the way it is", which I suspect is a defense mechanism for not knowing the answer.

Â Â Â Â Â
